definition: lit. tablet with inscription in gold/pass list for the top imperial examinations/roll of honor
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
variant of 榜[bang3]
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
to win top marks in the imperial examinations

sentences.english: Lin Yuhui once told Cheng Bijian to beware of high gold.
sentences.chinese: 林语慧曾经叮嘱高金榜提防程碧剑。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the National College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝贺您今年高考旗开得胜，金榜题名。

sentences.english: Jinbang title once, like a carp to leap onto the goal.
sentences.chinese: 一朝题名金榜，犹如鲤鱼跃上龙门。

sentences.english: Ones who recite more have more chances to stand out.
sentences.chinese: 只有背得越多，离金榜题名才越进一步。

sentences.english: He succeeded in the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 他在入学考试中金榜题名了。

sentences.english: Before the ship back on high Jinbang swear with Lin Yuhui walk.
sentences.chinese: 高金榜上船之前发誓日后回来带林语慧走。

sentences.english: I'm glad you passed the test.
sentences.chinese: 知道你金榜题名，我很高兴。

sentences.english: Passed Jinbang Rd , the destination is definitely the train station.
sentences.chinese: 经过金榜路，目标确定是火车站。

definition: top scorer in the palace examination (highest rank of the Imperial examination system)/see 榜眼[bang3 yan3] and 探花[tan4 hua1]/top scorer in college entrance examination 高考[gao1 kao3]/(fig.) the most brilliantly talented person in the field/leading light
(of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
lit. plucking a branch of osmanthus from the Toad Palace (i.e. the moon)/fig. to succeed in the imperial examination
first-placed candidate in the provincial imperial examinations (old)
provincial imperial examination graduate who ranked 1st in metropolitan examination (in Ming and Qing dynasties)
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
candidate who came third in the Han-lin examination/see 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2]
to publish a roll-call of successful candidates
3rd rank of candidates who passed the imperial examination
to publish class list of successful exam candidates
announcement of joyful news/CL:張|张[zhang1]
refers to academics employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards, forming the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院
imperial examinations
autograph/to sign one's name
candidate who came second in the Han-lin examination/see 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2]
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
